Name: Requiring the DOT to develop a map of current bicycle infrastructure conditions.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of transportation to develop a map of current bicycle infrastructure conditions

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: January 28, 2021 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - January 28, 2021

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Transportation to create a searchable map that shows all of the City’s bike lanes as well as conditions present in bike lanes including obstructions caused by street construction, maintenance or repair, weather and other hazards.

Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Subchapter 1 of chapter 1 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-159.5 to read as follows: \par
\ul\'a7 19-159.5. Map of current bicycle infrastructure conditions. a. No later than October 1, 2021, and on the first day of each month thereafter, the department shall make available on its website a searchable map of every bicycle lane in the city.\par
b. Such map shall include: \par
1. The location of any bicycle lane that is obstructed, in whole or in part, by street construction, maintenance or repair, or pursuant to any permit issued by an agency of the city, where such obstruction persists for a period of 14 days or longer;\par
2. The location of any temporary bicycle lane, as set forth in section 19-159.3;\par
3. Following any emergency weather declaration, the location of any bicycle lane that is obstructed, in whole or in part, by hazardous conditions including snow, ice and flooding, and weather specific recommendations for cycling in such conditions; \par
4. Locations exhibiting a pattern of crashes involving pedestrians and/or cyclists, as set forth in section 19-181; \par
5. The location of any bicycle lanes that exist in space shared with pedestrian paths; \par
6. The location of bicycle lane features that may lead to conflict with vehicles or other hazards, including, but not limited to narrow lane widths, high vehicle speeds or traffic volumes, and nonstandard lane or intersection designs; \par
7. The location of any active street resurfacing or reconstruction projects;\par
8. The location of any other potentially hazardous conditions present in bicycle lanes known to the department; \par
9. The location of all bicycle parking infrastructure;\par
10. The location of docks for bicycle share programs, and real time bicycle availability data, if available;\par
11. The locations of and information on any streets closed to vehicle traffic and open to bicycle travel;\par
12. The location of and information on businesses or other entities that provide bicycle repair, maintenance or other related services; \par
13. Information on reporting bicycle lane issues to appropriate agencies; \par
14. Reports of bicycle lane issues made through the 311 system; \par
15. Any bicycle traffic volume data collected by the department on an annual or more frequent basis; and\par
16. Information on planned bicycle lane projects for new or existing lanes. \par
\pard\ltrpar\noline\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect immediately. \par
